intro: Crossostephium californicum, commonly known as the California crossostephium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
